content:
• Friday, April 26, 2013
  • BIDU

    "Mobile monetization is distant, macro conditions do not warrant aggressive pricing inflation,...

    "Mobile monetization is distant, macro conditions do not warrant aggressive pricing inflation, and online video is competitive," writes Goldman on Baidu (BIDU -7.9%), following its Q1 miss. The firm thinks surging SG&A and traffic acquisition costs will lead op. margin to fall to 39% in 2013 from 50.5% in 2012. Brean (downgrading to Hold) and Barclays also aren't confident about near-term mobile monetization. On the earnings call, CEO Robin Li admitted mobile ad prices, though "growing nicely," remain below PC prices. Rival Qihoo (QIHU -0.3%), which may have contributed to Baidu's 6.5% Q/Q drop in revenue per ad customer, was nearly unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • AXU

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AXU +3%. EGN +3%. NCTY +2%. GTE +2%. PMCS +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AXU +3%. EGN +3%. NCTY +2%. GTE +2%. PMCS +2%.
    After-hours top losers: NSPR -3%. TRX -2%. TIVO -2%. WDAY -2%. ZOLT -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • RCII

    Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII) authorizes an increase to its stock repurchase program from $1B to...

    Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII) authorizes an increase to its stock repurchase program from $1B to $1.25B. So far, RCII has repurchased a total of 31,585,314 shares for approximately $794.8M since the plan's inception. In the current year, the company has repurchased a total of 465,035 shares totalling approximately $17.4M. Shares +1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • DHI

    D.R. Horton's (DHI +8.7%) strong day off its earlier Q1 report comes as no surprise to Wells...

    D.R. Horton's (DHI +8.7%) strong day off its earlier Q1 report comes as no surprise to Wells Fargo's Adam Rudiger, who says the report follows on the heels of other strong reports from home builders earlier this week. Rudiger notes DHI's solid order growth and gross margin improvement mean the company is near to achieving a more "normal" operating margin, and reiterates an Outperform on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 2 Comments

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: TAN +14.6%. XHB +6.2%. OIL +5.5%. USO +5.5%. PHYS +4.4%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: TAN +14.6%. XHB +6.2%. OIL +5.5%. USO +5.5%. PHYS +4.4%.
    ETF Losers: VXX -5.8%. GAZ -5.3%. UNG -4.5%. DBA -1.0%. EPI -0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK +4.5%) closes with a strong gain after BlueMountain Capital discloses a 5.6% stake...

    Lexmark (LXK +4.5%) closes with a strong gain after BlueMountain Capital discloses a 5.6% stake in the struggling and heavily-shorted printer maker. Shares jumped earlier this week thanks to a Q1 beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +2%) spiked over the final hour trading, following news its anticipated infringement...

    TiVo (TIVO +2%) spiked over the final hour trading, following news its anticipated infringement trial against Google-owned Motorola Mobility has been set for June 10. Given the huge settlements TiVo has received in its IP disputes with pay-TV providers, many think the could obtain a giant windfall from Motorola (a top set-top box maker until the recent sale of the business to Arris).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • GCAP

    Gain Capital Holdings (GCAP -6.6%) falls after FXCM withdraws its acquisition proposal. GCAP's...

    Gain Capital Holdings (GCAP -6.6%) falls after FXCM withdraws its acquisition proposal. GCAP's acquisition of Global Futures and Forex consumed enough cash to "fundamentally impact the balance sheet and capital synergies that were an important driver of our proposal," says FXCM CEO Drew Niv. The merger would have combined two of the largest U.S.-based players in online currency trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • VICR

    Vicor (VICR +1.1%) gains today after announcing the results of its Dutch Auction, saying it...

    Vicor (VICR +1.1%) gains today after announcing the results of its Dutch Auction, saying it agreed to pay about $6.7M to repurchase 1,341,575 of its common shares at $5.00. The shares purchased are equivalent to about 4.8% of the total stock outstanding. The tender offer, which ended at the close of trading on April 22nd, was financed by cash on hand.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • EQM

    Credit Suisse upgrades EQT Midstream Partners (EQM +4.7%) to Outperform after issuing Q1...

    Credit Suisse upgrades EQT Midstream Partners (EQM +4.7%) to Outperform after issuing Q1 results well ahead of the firm's expectations and increasing its FY 2013 guidance on EBITDA and distribution cash flow, and cuts Exterran Partners (EXLP) and DCP Midstream (DPM) on valuation (I, II). EQM is enjoying higher throughput on its assets as Marcellus shale activity remains robust.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • ATML

    Atmel (ATML +5.1%) rallies strongly after touch controller rival Synaptics (SYNA +9%) delivers...

    Atmel (ATML +5.1%) rallies strongly after touch controller rival Synaptics (SYNA +9%) delivers blowout FQ2 (March quarter) results thanks to a 57% Y/Y increase in mobile-related sales, and offers very strong FQ3 guidance. During its earnings call, Synaptics noted its controllers have been designed into the Samsung Galaxy S4, the HTC One, Sony's Xperia Z, and the BlackBerry Z10 - Atmel is also an S4 supplier. UniPixel (UNXL +2.9%) might also be up in sympathy - Synaptics named UniPixel as one of the metal mesh touch sensor firms it's working with.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • ACCO

    ACCO Brands (ACCO -5.2%) is among today's big decliners after its Q1 top and bottom line miss....

    ACCO Brands (ACCO -5.2%) is among today's big decliners after its Q1 top and bottom line miss. The stock's woes can be partly attributed to the company's outlook, as FY13 revenue guidance ("roughly even with the prior year") disappointed the market. On the call, CJS Securities analyst Arnold Ursaner questioned whether the company's plan to improve gross margins by 100 basis points during the year was still realistic given the tepid top line guidance. CEO Boris Elisman said that margin expansion is "still part of the plan." (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • NR

    Newpark Resources (NR +16.9%) soars to a 52-week high after posting Q1 beats in earnings and...

    Newpark Resources (NR +16.9%) soars to a 52-week high after posting Q1 beats in earnings and revenues, as the oilfield services provider bucked the industry trend with its fluids systems and engineering business, which saw a 13% increase in revenue. News of a $50M share repurchase plan helps.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • RMD

    Shares of Resmed (RMD +1.4%) moves up after its FQ3 bottom line EPS came in better than Street...

    Shares of Resmed (RMD +1.4%) moves up after its FQ3 bottom line EPS came in better than Street estimates late yesterday. Net income jumped 31% Y/Y, driven by strong sales performance out of its Americas segment. Separately, Goldman Sachs adds the stock to its Conviction List on the back of the results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • CLF

    Nomura is sticking with its Buy rating on Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -3.4%) following solid...

    Nomura is sticking with its Buy rating on Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -3.4%) following solid Q1 results but cuts its price target to $26 from $37. The firm believes iron ore fundamentals should be well supported for 2013, but the market will continue to worry about larger surplus markets in 2014-15; it also sees continued execution risk at Bloom Lake.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • ATGE

    For-profit education names are lower across the board, taking a step back after yesterday's...

    For-profit education names are lower across the board, taking a step back after yesterday's gains. This week saw both DeVry (DV -3.7%) and ITT Educational (ESI-OLD -10.6%) report significant Y/Y declines in enrollment ( -17% at DV's namesake university and -14.2% total student enrollment at ESI) and today investors seem to be second guessing ESI after Thursday's rally as a price target hike at Barclays ($16) is overshadowed by Compass Point's downgrade and revised target ($12). Sector roundup: (APOL -0.7%), (CECO -3.5%), (STRA -0.5%), (LINC -3.7%), (LOPE -1.2%), (BPI).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEM

    Agnico-Eagle (AEM -5.7%) is pushing to start production at its La India project in Mexico,...

    Agnico-Eagle (AEM -5.7%) is pushing to start production at its La India project in Mexico, despite the uncertainty which has prompted rivals to clamp down on spending and shelve new developments, as CEO Sean Boyd believes gold's price drop is an overreaction. But La India is marginal, and with AEM's big Meliadine mine in Canada’s far north not expected until 2018, it's not clear where future growth will come.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +11.8%) might have a little breathing room with its cash flow headaches as...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +11.8%) might have a little breathing room with its cash flow headaches as Goldman Sachs reportedly rounded up financing for the retailer of $1.75B. The news is good enough to help shares pop over $17 for the first time in over a month. (Previous: Stars starting to line up for JCP?)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 8 Comments
  • LPNT

    Lifepoint Hospitals (LPNT +2.2%) moves up today in spite of posting a mixed first-quarter...

    Lifepoint Hospitals (LPNT +2.2%) moves up today in spite of posting a mixed first-quarter earnings report. Net revenue jumped 9.4%, largely due to acquisitions as the rural hospital operator's admissions and surgeries continued to drop. On a same-hospital basis, admissions were down 5.9%. Inpatient surgeries declined 10% while outpatient surgeries fell 6.9%. Revenue per patient increased 2.6%. Provisions for doubtful accounts rose 15% to $169.1M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN -1.8%) is off in sympathy with Expedia (EXPE -9.1%), after the latter provides...

    Priceline (PCLN -1.8%) is off in sympathy with Expedia (EXPE -9.1%), after the latter provides downbeat earnings call remarks about Hotwire (previous), and lowers its 2013 adjusted EBITDA forecast (exc. trivago) by $20M-$30M. Expedia claims Hotwire, which (like Priceline) offers opaque travel inventory at a discount, is affected by a tough domestic car rental market, improving hotel occupancy rates (leads to higher prices), and tougher competition from Priceline, which recently launched its Express Deals hotel service. Expedia's gross bookings rose 16% Y/Y in Q1, down from Q4 and Q3's 19%; hotel room nights rose 28%, and air tickets 9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • KEG

    Key Energy (KEG -15.6%) is the day's biggest energy decliner following a dismal Q1 which...

    Key Energy (KEG -15.6%) is the day's biggest energy decliner following a dismal Q1 which recorded lower Q/Q and Y/Y readings in earnings, revenues and EBITDA. U.S. onshore drilling rig counts declined 3% Q/Q; Mexico, its largest international customer, reduced activity during the quarter. KEG sees activity picking up as the year goes on.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (BSX -1.6%) gives back a pre-market pop plus more today, despite being upped...

    Boston Scientific (BSX -1.6%) gives back a pre-market pop plus more today, despite being upped to Outperform at Credit Suisse with a price target of $8.75. The firm says the company is on track for the first time in years to post positive sales growth, and that management's "continued commitment to returning to positive sales growth H213 & to improving margins despite a tough pricing environment" is encouraging.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • AIG

    Answer: "About $2B in market cap." Question: "How much are four executives really worth?" AIG...

    Answer: "About $2B in market cap." Question: "How much are four executives really worth?" AIG has fallen 3% and can't get up after Berkshire poached 4 of its top insurance men. The question comes from Bernstein (presumably Josh Stirling). The dour answer from Forbes' Steve Schaefer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 13 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +3.6%) continues a strong week after hosting its annual meeting yesterday afternoon...

    Rambus (RMBS +3.6%) continues a strong week after hosting its annual meeting yesterday afternoon (transcript), and filing its Q1 10-Q this morning. During the meeting, CEO Ronald Black promised litigation expenses will continue to drop, and touted the potential of Rambus' LED bulb design (said to require fewer LEDs and offer superior reliability), and mentioned the company has a solar cell prototype that leverages its LED tech. Shares fell last week in response to Rambus' Q1 miss and light Q2 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CX

    Mexican cement maker Cemex (CX +3.6%) trades sharply higher despite posting big Q1 misses in...

    Mexican cement maker Cemex (CX +3.6%) trades sharply higher despite posting big Q1 misses in earnings, sales and EBITDA. Citigroup suspects a negative investor reaction was softened by optimism for improvement in H2, and Sterne Agee thinks significant weather issues in Q1 and weakness in the stock over the past few weeks have averted any potential selloff today.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • DS

    Efficient markets? Newcastle Investment (NCT +2.5%) shoots higher after announcing May 15 as the...

    Efficient markets? Newcastle Investment (NCT +2.5%) shoots higher after announcing May 15 as the spinoff date for New Residential (NYSE:NRZ). It's not as if this is news (other than the exact timing), yet investors have rushed in to buy. One week ago, UBS noted the absurdity of anybody selling on the idea the spinoff wasn't going through. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • TSLA

    The big news from Tesla Motors (TSLA +0.2%) is that the company will offer fully-loaded Model S...

    The big news from Tesla Motors (TSLA +0.2%) is that the company will offer fully-loaded Model S vehicles as service loaners in connection with its no-fault warranty program. In a margin-defying twist, Tesla drivers can keep the loaner car if they like it better. During a conference call, CEO Elon Musk also says the automaker's warranty will be transferable amongst owners. It's not quite the news some investors were looking for as shares of Tesla Motors move off their daily highs. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 28 Comments
  • ITGR

    Greatbatch (GB -4.5%) slips after its Q1 top line came up shy of estimates late yesterday as...

    Greatbatch (GB -4.5%) slips after its Q1 top line came up shy of estimates late yesterday as total sales dipped by 7% Y/Y. Cardiac/Neuromodulation revenue decreased -5%, Electrochem -11%, due largely to tough comps in energy and military markets, Orthopaedic +11% on implant market share gains and new product launches.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • CERN

    Credit Suisse raises its price target on Cerner (CERN +5%) to $95 from $88 after Thursday's Q1...

    Credit Suisse raises its price target on Cerner (CERN +5%) to $95 from $88 after Thursday's Q1 report. "At the risk of sounding like a broken record, CERN reported better than expected bookings, solid operating metrics, and strong cash flow," analyst Glen Santangelo notes before saying "the conference call [makes] clear management's intent [to] further competitive advantages and build upon analytics/population health and works platforms." (call transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • DYAX

    Dyax (DYAX -33%) plummets today on a dismal Q1 report. Net sales came in at $8.6M, an increase...

    Dyax (DYAX -33%) plummets today on a dismal Q1 report. Net sales came in at $8.6M, an increase over Q112 sales, but only about half of the $16.01M the Street expected. Net losses were $11.2M or $0.11 per share, relatively in line with Q112, but more than twice the $0.05 per share loss analysts expected. The company blames the miss on weak Kalbitor sales due to a decrease in the number of new patients added and a decline in the number of treatments among existing hereditary angioedema patients.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN -6.9%) is giving back most of its 2013 gains as the Street decides a revenue miss...

    Amazon (AMZN -6.9%) is giving back most of its 2013 gains as the Street decides a revenue miss and light profit guidance outweigh a still-improving gross margin. Slowing growth and a lack of profits for the international ops is a concern for many, even if forex is a factor - international media sales rose only 1% Y/Y, though other merchandise sales rose 28%. On the earnings call, management admitted (echoing eBay) "there is some [international] softness from a macro standpoint," while adding Amazon is investing heavily in China, Italy, and Spain. Nomura is staying bullish, touting the fact total growth is holding steady.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 12 Comments
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -2.8%) slumps after Samsung (OTC:SSNLF -0.5% in Seoul) posts Q1 results...

    Universal Display (PANL -2.8%) slumps after Samsung (OTC:SSNLF -0.5% in Seoul) posts Q1 results in-line with its projections. As usual, Samsung didn't provide details about phone sales, though it did note smartphone sales fell by a single-digit % Q/Q in the seasonally weak quarter (rivals often fared worse), and expected "weak seasonality to continue" in the smartphone market ahead of a 2H pickup. Still, Galaxy S III sales were steady in Q1 ahead of the S IV launch, and Note II sales rose. Also: Larry Page appears to be a fan of Samsung's OLED displays. (Samsung slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • LOGM

    Midday top 10 gainers: LOGM +24%. LAS +17%. CTCT +16%. NR +15%. DQ +15%. WBSN +14%. QLIK +13%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: LOGM +24%. LAS +17%. CTCT +16%. NR +15%. DQ +15%. WBSN +14%. QLIK +13%. CPGI +13%. SPWR +12%. CSIQ +12%.
    Midday top 10 losers: DYAX -32%. HXM -23%. DLA -16%. IKAN -16%. KEG -15%. OTC:FALC -14%. COBR -13%. PKI -13%. XIDE -12%. MMSI -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • ECHO

    Echo Global Logistics (ECHO -5.4%) slides after its Q1 misses estimates across the board. Net...

    Echo Global Logistics (ECHO -5.4%) slides after its Q1 misses estimates across the board. Net profit fell 10% as the transport-services firm's growing expenses and charges offset a 21% jump in revenue. The company also lowered its FY13 earnings outlook, now expecting to earn between $0.78 to $0.84 per share on revenue of $900M to $940M. The company had previously targeted an EPS of $0.82 to $0.90 on revenue of $940M to $980M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • SWKS

    In spite of an FQ2 beat, Skyworks (SWKS -3.6%) is selling off, as the Street looks unfavorably...

    In spite of an FQ2 beat, Skyworks (SWKS -3.6%) is selling off, as the Street looks unfavorably on guidance for FQ3 revenue of $435M and EPS of $0.53 (consensus is $443.2M and $0.52). Though EPS is expected to get a boost from a 130-180 bps Q/Q increase in gross margin, the revenue guidance might be a sign Samsung strength isn't enough to offset Apple weakness. On its earnings call, Skyworks claimed a "strategic transition from some lower margin components ... towards more margin-rich custom solutions" is responsible. Apple image sensor supplier OmniVision (OVTI -2.8%) is also off, possibly thanks to both Skyworks and Cirrus Logic. (TriQuint) (RF Micro)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto's (RIO -2.3%) Kennecott Utah Copper expects to start transporting copper ore to the...

    Rio Tinto's (RIO -2.3%) Kennecott Utah Copper expects to start transporting copper ore to the crusher at its Bingham mine within a few days, but a force majeure on related customer contracts remains in place until operations return to normal. Rio said during its Q1 operations review that it expects to produce 100K metric tons less of refined copper this year due to the mudslide which led to the mine's shutdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • ITRI

    Itron (ITRI -12.37%) gets slammed today after reporting a big Q1 miss this morning. as the...

    Itron (ITRI -12.37%) gets slammed today after reporting a big Q1 miss this morning. as the utility-meter maker hasn't year been able to generate sufficient new business to replace the completion of contracts last year in the energy segment. Bookings for the quarter fell 8.4% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • NE

    Noble Corp. (NE -1.8%) shareholders approve the driller's recommended board candidates, as...

    Noble Corp. (NE -1.8%) shareholders approve the driller's recommended board candidates, as expected, but Credit Suisse sees the real action happening in coming weeks as 8.3% stakeholder Fir Tree could prove active in helping structure the much anticipated spinoff of NE's non-core assets. Bottom line, CS says: The higher the dividend of the legacy assets, the higher the multiple.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • UAL

    The squeaky wheel gets the grease as the U.S. House votes to approve a bill to end the furlough...

    The squeaky wheel gets the grease as the U.S. House votes to approve a bill to end the furlough of FAA employees. Those that bought airline stocks (NYSEARCA:FAA) on Monday when overwrought reports of long delays at U.S. airports rattled the sector made a good call.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • ALLT

    Allot (ALLT -3%) has fallen to within 3% of its 52-week low, possibly thanks to Alcatel-Lucent's...

    Allot (ALLT -3%) has fallen to within 3% of its 52-week low, possibly thanks to Alcatel-Lucent's Q1 report. While reporting healthy North American sales, Alcatel's European sales fell 10% Y/Y - EMEA made up 44% of Allot's revenue in Q4, and 61% in Q3. The deep packet inspection (DPI) hardware vendor delivers its Q1 report on May 7; Infonetics recently estimated the DPI market grew 28% in 2012, and that Allot passed private Sandvine to become its top vendor.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • AGN

    Another day, another patent litigation settlement for Actavis (ACT +2.3%). The company says it...

    Another day, another patent litigation settlement for Actavis (ACT +2.3%). The company says it has reached an agreement with Purdue Pharmaceuticals under which ACT will be licensed to sell "a specific number of bottles of generic OxyContin" beginning early next year assuming the company obtains FDA approval. The deal could potentially mean $100M in gross profits for ACT in 2014 and 2015. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM

  • A sharp reversal in commodities over the last hour has brought the entire sector into the red....

    A sharp reversal in commodities over the last hour has brought the entire sector into the red. Gold (GLD -0.6%) - looking like it was set to challenge $1,500/oz. an hour ago - is back to $1,452/oz. Silver (SLV -2.3%). WTI crude (USO -1.2%) falls to $92.46. Copper (JJC -1.9%) dives back to $3.18/lb.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 13 Comments
  • WOOF

    Animal hospital operator VCA Antech (WOOF +8.5%) moves up after Q1 revenue came up short of...

    Animal hospital operator VCA Antech (WOOF +8.5%) moves up after Q1 revenue came up short of consensus, but its EPS beat slightly. Additionally, the company says its board of directors has approved a $125M share repurchase program. The company's market cap is currently around $2.1B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • INFA

    For the second quarter in a row (previous), Informatica (INFA +5.9%) is jumping post-earnings....

    For the second quarter in a row (previous), Informatica (INFA +5.9%) is jumping post-earnings. In addition to beating Q1 estimates, the data warehousing software firm guided on its earnings call for 2013 revenue of $885M-$925M and EPS of $1.31-$1.46 vs. a consensus of $885.3M and $1.40. Q2 guidance, affected by sales/R&D investments, is for revenue of $215M-$225M and EPS of $0.29-$0.32 vs. a consensus of $212.5M and $0.32. Deferred revenue rose 6% Q/Q in Q1 to $267M. Teradata (TDC +2.9%) is getting a boost from Informatica, and perhaps also Qlik.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy Services (BAS +4.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Accumulate at Global Hunter, which...

    Basic Energy Services (BAS +4.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Accumulate at Global Hunter, which believes the bottom is in place for all of BAS's business lines, and its Q1 performance operationally was commendable despite depressed activity levels. CapitalOne also raises shares to Add from Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • SUPN

    Supernus Pharmaceuticals (SUPN +10.6%) moves up after pricing its $75M offering of convertible...

    Supernus Pharmaceuticals (SUPN +10.6%) moves up after pricing its $75M offering of convertible senior secured notes due 2019. The company intends to use approximately $21M million of the net proceeds to repay in full its borrowings under and terminate its secured credit facility and the remainder of the net proceeds to fund the commercialization of its approved and tentatively approved drugs, Oxtellar XR and Trokendi XR, and to continue development of its pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • PKI

    ISI's Ross Muken downgrades PerkinElmer (PKI -11.7%) to Buy from Strong Buy after the company's...

    ISI's Ross Muken downgrades PerkinElmer (PKI -11.7%) to Buy from Strong Buy after the company's Q1 miss. "This is a pretty terrible outcome from at least [an] earnings and operating income standpoint," Muken said on the call after asking management if they have "a hold" on where business is and what caused "pullbacks in demand." CEO Robert Friel cited a political shakeup for weakness in Japan and said he is still "fairly bearish on Europe." ISI's new price target: $36. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • UHS

    Universal Health Services (UHS +2.9%) moves up today after its Q1 beat on the bottom line, and...

    Universal Health Services (UHS +2.9%) moves up today after its Q1 beat on the bottom line, and despite missing on revenue. Net earnings fell 6.8% Y/Y as expenses slightly outpaced revenue growth and special gains boosted last years results. Operating expenses were up 4.2%, while revenue from acute-care hospitals edged up just 0.7% and adjusted admissions decreased 1.5%. On the upside, revenue per adjusted admission increased 2.2%, and behavioral health hospitals' same-facility revenue improved 2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • XIDEQ

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -11.8%) sinks for a second day after regulators effectively force the...

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -11.8%) sinks for a second day after regulators effectively force the closure of a California lead recycling center. Wedbush analyst Craig Irwin downgrades the shares to Neutral and lowers his price target to $2 from $6. The closure "raises issues around a potential impact on the balance sheet and near-term profitability," he says. Shares are now trading under $1.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -4.1%) succumbs to a bout of profit-taking, giving back a chunk of...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -4.1%) succumbs to a bout of profit-taking, giving back a chunk of yesterday's 15% run-up. Probably not helping is news that chief strategy officer Steven Raguz is exiting the company effective May 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • CRUS

    Though its results and guidance were in-line with the numbers provided in its April 17 warning,...

    Though its results and guidance were in-line with the numbers provided in its April 17 warning, earnings call commentary is hurting Cirrus Logic (CRUS -9.6%).
